greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Periodic part of continued fraction for sqrt(n), encoded by recursively interleaving the bits in the binary expansions of the repeating terms.
comment: Could be made less gigantic by omitting final terms in continued fraction, which are always 2*c0.
example: sqrt(3)=1+[1,2] so a(3) is encoded as:
results.author: _Marc LeBrun_, Feb 07 2001
